intro: Luciliocline catamarcensis, commonly known as the Catamarca lily, is a rare flowering plant native to the arid regions of Argentina. It belongs to the Iridaceae family and is characterized by its striking, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pale yellow. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and is adapted to withstand extreme drought conditions. Its bulbs are underground storage organs that help it survive in harsh environments. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
